benchmark_details.name: KokoroChat (Japanese Psychological Counseling Dialogue Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: KokoroChat is a Japanese psychological counseling dialogue dataset developed using a role-playing approach with trained counselors. It comprises 6,589 long-form dialogues, each accompanied by client feedback, aimed at enhancing the performance of language models in generating psychological counseling responses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a high-quality dataset for training and evaluating language models in the context of psychological counseling dialogues.

data.source: Collected through role-playing interactions among trained counselors.
data.annotation: Client feedback was collected after each dialogue based on multiple criteria.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the generated responses compared with ground truth from dialogues.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in terms of quality and relevance of generated responses.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared with other existing mental health datasets, KokoroChat achieved higher dialogue quality scores.
methodology.validation: Validation was conducted through participant feedback and expert evaluations.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes a diverse group of counselors and clients, with demographics collected for balance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Participant privacy was ensured by prohibiting the sharing of real-life personal issues.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were fully informed about the simulated nature of dialogues and voluntarily engaged.
